radiographic_examinations.findings: Trace residual right pleural effusion, with associated dependent atelectasis. No focal consolidation seen at the lung bases. Moderate hiatus hernia. Gallbladder appears more thickened, with a newly striated/lamellated appearance. Marked increase in induration and inflammation in the pericholecystic fat. Sigmoid diverticulosis, without evidence of acute diverticulitis. Extensive degenerative changes in the visualized thoracolumbar spine.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The gallbladder wall now appears more thickened compared to prior study, with a newly striated/lamellated appearance and marked increase in induration and inflammation in the pericholecystic fat.
